The police found â‚¹65,760 from her bag and a diary in which she had maintained an account of her stealing. Rupaa admitted that she was picking the pocket at the crowded fair.

348.title: NIA arrests 6 people for trafficking Rohingya Muslims into India
348.article_body: The NIA arrested six people who were allegedly part of a syndicate involved in the illegal trafficking of Rohingya Muslims into Indian territory, an official said. The network was operating in the border areas of West Bengal, Assam and Meghalaya as well as other parts of the country, the official added.

349.title: Make all efforts to bring back mortal remains of Indian student who died in Ukraine: PM
349.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. During the meeting, PM Modi directed that all possible efforts should be made to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who died in Ukraine.

350.title: Kyiv is always beautiful, even during war: Zelenskyy's advisors in video from Kyiv
350.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's close advisors recently shared a video from the country's capital, Kyiv, on social media. In a tweet, Mykhailo Podolyak, an Advisor to the Head of the President's Office, wrote, "Kyiv is always beautiful. Even during wartime." A correspondent also quoted them as saying, "It's a shame the city is so empty but we did find coffee!"

351.title: Naomi Osaka breaks down after woman in crowd says 'You suck', video surfaces
351.article_body: Naomi Osaka broke down in the post-match interview after her defeat against Veronika Kudermetova in round of 64 of Indian Wells Masters. Earlier, a woman in the crowd shouted, "Naomi, you suck." Osaka said being heckled didn't bother her, but an old video of Serena Williams and Venus Williams being heckled at the same tournament replayed in her mind.

352.title: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
352.article_body: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."

353.title: People in UP feel it's their own govt, not of some particular community: Piyush Goyal
353.article_body: Following BJPâ€™s victory in four states including UP, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that people in UP now feel that it is their "own" government and not the government of a particular community. Commenting on BJPâ€™s performance in Punjab, Goyal stated that the BJP has increased its influence in the state significantly.

354.title: He's like my real brother: Zeeshan on 'Bloody Brothers' co-star Jaideep
354.article_body: Actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub has said actor Jaideep Ahlawat is like his real brother. "It's been 11-12 years that I have known him," he added. Zeeshan Ayyub, who shares screen space with Jaideep in 'Bloody Brothers', added that they got time to understand each other more while working on the show. "We...ended up making great memories," he said.

355.title: Looking forward to playing with Bumrah: MI's Mills ahead of IPL 2022
355.article_body: MI pacer Tymal Mills, who was bought by the franchise for â‚¹1.5 crore in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's looking forward to playing with Jasprit Bumrah in upcoming season of IPL . "Had the chance to spend a little bit of time with Bumrah during the World Cup," he added. The England pacer had previously represented RCB in IPL.

356.title: Over 55,000 cases settled in Rachakonda during Lok Adalat session
356.article_body: As many as 55,772 cases in Rachakonda Police Commissionerate were settled during National Lok Adalat at the Ranga Reddy District Court on Saturday. Of the cases settled, 51,318 were Disaster Management Act and e-petty cases, 3,025 cases had been filed under IPC and 1,429 cases were related to drunken driving. Lok Adalat was supervised by Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat.

357.title: 3 arrested for selling rice from ration shops in black market in Pune
357.article_body: Three people have been arrested in the Pune district for allegedly selling rice and wheat from government ration shops at higher prices in the black market. A truck carrying 358 wheat bags and 605 rice bags, all worth â‚¹28.29 lakh, was also seized from them. The Pimpri Chinchwad Police has also booked five others in this connection.

358.title: Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name creating confusion: Commuters
358.article_body: Commuters have said that Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name is "creating confusion" as it's located at a distance from residential areas. One local said that his relatives took an auto to reach Bhosari which is five-six km away from Bhosari station, as the station is in Nashik Phata. A Maha-Metro spokesperson said that they're thinking of changing Bhosari station's name.

359.title: Anand Mahindra shares video of Cong leader Deora's music performance, calls him 'cool'
359.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video featuring Congress leader Milind Deora, where the latter can be seen playing the guitar onstage at the Mahindra Blues Festival. Mahindra also mentioned that Deora goes by the stage name of MD Mississippi. He wrote, "His party is the INC, & with him, the 'C' stands for Cool!"

360.title: There's lack of confidence: Wasim Jaffer on Virat Kohli's form
360.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings against Sri Lanka in the ongoing pink-ball Test, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "Once Kohli gets a hundred...I am quite sure that we will get to see the old Kohli." Jaffer added, "[Currently], there is a lack of confidence. The kind of runs that we expect from Kohli [are] not seen."

361.title: Mumbai's maximum temperature rises to 38.9Â°C, highest in Maharashtra
361.article_body: The maximum temperature in Mumbai on Sunday rose to 38.9Â°C, which is 5.4Â°C above normal. The city's maximum temperature is also the highest reported in Maharashtra. People shared memes online about the rising temperatures. "I feel like I am in the Sahara desert," a user wrote on Twitter.

362.title: Ukrainians who told Russian ship 'go f*** yourself' honoured with postage stamp
362.article_body: Ukraine is honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" by releasing a postage stamp, the country's First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Emine Dzheppar said. "The sketch by artist Boris Groh...will soon be published by Ukraine's state postal company," said Dzheppar. The soldiers had famously refused to surrender Snake Island to Russian forces.

363.title: 2 kill man who objected to their eve-teasing, smoking in B'luru
363.article_body: The police are searching for two brothers who allegedly killed a 19-year-old man who had repeatedly objected to the duo's eve-teasing and smoking near his house in Bengaluru. The duo had reportedly got enraged after the deceased complained to their father about the same and had attacked him. The duo had also apparently mocked the sister of the deceased's friend.

364.title: Big B signed papers for Amjad's surgery after accident: Shehla Khan
364.article_body: Shehla Khan recalled the time when she and her late actor-husband Amjad Khan met with an accident in Maharashtra's Sawantwadi. She revealed that Amjad had to be shifted to Goa because a mob had gathered outside the hospital in Sawantwadi. "That's when Amitabh (Bachchan) ji gave his signature for...doctors to proceed with...tracheostomy (a surgical procedure to ease breathing)," Shehla added.

365.title: Ukraine to adopt crop sowing campaign to ensure food security: PM
365.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal said on Sunday that the country will adopt crop sowing campaign in a bid to ensure food security amid the Russian invasion. Shmyhal added that while Ukraine has sufficient volume of basic food products for next few months, it must "think about the future". Notably, Ukraine has also banned export of wheat and other food staples.

366.title: Jasprit Bumrah takes his first Test five-wicket haul on Indian soil
366.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah today completed his first five-wicket haul in Test cricket on Indian soil. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5 in Sri Lanka's first innings in the ongoing Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. Overall, it is Bumrah's eighth five-wicket haul in Test cricket. Sri Lanka were dismissed for 109 runs in the first innings.

367.title: Nawazuddin is among the best actors in the country: Bhumi Pednekar
367.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar in an interview has called actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui one of the best actors in the country, adding that he is a stalwart in cinema. "I have waited long for an opportunity to work with Nawaz sir...I am going to learn so much from him," Bhumi added. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Afwaah'.

368.title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 7.9%
368.article_body: Morgan Stanley has cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 by 50 basis points to 7.9% and raised retail inflation projection to 6%. The firm also expects current account deficit to widen to a 10-year high of 3% of GDP. High oil prices, trade and tighter financial conditions are expected to affect the Indian economy in FY23.

369.title: Virat Kohli imitates Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action, video goes viral
369.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli imitating Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action during an innings break on the first day of the second Test against Sri Lanka has gone viral. Kohli was also seen imitating actions of other bowlers. Cricketer-turned-commentator Irfan Pathan commented that Kohli makes the atmosphere of the dressing room "amazing".

370.title: Russia conducts airstrike on Ukrainian military base near Poland border
370.article_body: Russia launched an airstrike on a Ukrainian military base in Yavoriv which lies just about 25 km from the Polish border, authorities in Lviv said on Sunday. "According to preliminary data, they fired eight missiles," said the authorities. "There are no dead but information about the injured and wounded is being clarified," said a Ukrainian official.

371.title: Startups must help India become self-reliant in energy, defence: Goyal
371.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal urged startups to help India become self-reliant in energy and defence sectors. "The present Ukraine-Russia crisis is a wakeup call for all of us, not to be dependent on crude oil and defence equipment," he said. Giving an example of how startups dealt with COVID-19 crisis, he said, "Every crisis can be converted into an opportunity."

372.title: One of the scariest moments of my life, I suffered a blood clot in my brain: Hailey
372.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, singer Justin Bieber's wife, confirmed on Instagram that she was hospitalised after suffering stroke-like symptoms. The 25-year-old wrote, "I suffered a very small blood clot to my brain, which caused a small lack of oxygen, but my body passed it on its own." She went on to call it "one of the scariest moments" of her life.

373.title: US man goes to Ukraine to save daughter & grandson, says 'That's what dads do'
373.article_body: A US man has gone to Ukraine to help his daughter and grandson escape. William Hubbard flew to Poland and crossed the border to Ukraine on foot before joining his daughter and 8-month-old grandson near Kyiv. On Friday, the three reached the border at Slovakia. "That's what dads do. They take care of their family," Hubbard said.

374.title: Reports on CEO's arrest for rash driving exaggerated, no harm was caused: Paytm
374.article_body: Responding to reports of Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's arrest and subsequent bail in a case of rash driving in February, a company spokesperson called it a "minor incident". The spokesperson added that no harm was caused to any person or property due to it and that media reports claiming the nature of the arrest are exaggerated.

375.title: Woman raped inside bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar; 2 arrested
375.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly raping a woman inside a bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar. A search is underway to find another accused, Dhar SP said. Police said bus driver, conductor and cleaner did not drop the woman at her destination Longsari. After all other passengers left, the accused stopped the bus at a secluded place and raped her.

376.title: No dirty water will flow into Yamuna by December-end, says NMCG official
376.article_body: No dirty water will be flowing into the Yamuna by December-end as all drains carrying sewage into the river will be tapped, a senior NMCG official said. There are 18 drains that deliver dirty water into the Yamuna and plans are afoot to tap these drains and divert dirty water to sewage treatment plants, NMCG Director-General, G Asok Kumar, said.

377.title: Thousands of Russian tourists stuck in Thailand amid Ukraine war
377.article_body: Thousands of Russian tourists running short of cash are reportedly stranded in Thailand as they are unable to return due to various sanctions and cancelled flights over war in Ukraine. There are about 6,500 Russian tourists stuck in Phuket, Surat Thani, Krabi and Pattaya, in addition to 1,000 Ukrainians, said the Governor of Tourism Authority of Thailand.

378.title: US authorises $200 million for additional weapons to Ukraine
378.article_body: US government on Saturday said that it has given "immediate" authorisation $200 million for additional arms and equipment to Ukraine for its defence amid Russia's invasion of the country. US State Secretary Antony Blinken said that this will help Ukraine meet "armoured, airborne and other threats it's facing". This brings US aid to Ukraine since January 2021 to $1.2 billion.

379.title: You got BMW within 1 year, I can't buy 2nd hand Porsche?: Ashneer to BharatPe CEO
379.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Sunday in a tweet responded to the claims of his "lavish lifestyle", including owning a Porsche car. "I am proud Suhail Sameer (BharatPe's CEO) that within 1 year of joining BharatPe you could buy BMW Z4 convertible sports car," Ashneer tweeted. He added, "Ironic that you believe...as Founder (I) can't even afford a 2nd hand Porsche. TouchÃ©!!"

380.title: UK govt offers â‚¹35,000/month to residents to house Ukrainian refugees
380.article_body: Britain will pay its citizens Â£350 (around â‚¹35,000) per month if they offer Ukrainian refugees a spare room or property for a minimum period of six months. The government said the new scheme called "Homes for Ukraine" will allow refugees to come to Britain even if they don't have family ties. Notably, about 2 million people have already fled Ukraine.

381.title: 38 held from fake Gurugram call centre for extortion on pretext of loan recovery
381.article_body: Police busted a fake call centre in Gurugram's Sector 20 and arrested 38 people. The accused used to allegedly extort money from loan borrowers by threatening to send their morphed photos and videos to friends and relatives on pretext of recovering the loan amount. Police claimed the accused extorted nearly â‚¹2 crore till date. They called around 700 people regularly.

382.title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting on India's security preparedness
382.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a high-level meeting to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, S Jaishankar and Nirmala Sitharaman were seen taking part in the meeting with PM Modi. NSA Ajit Doval and Foreign Secretary Harsh V Shringla also attended the meeting.

383.title: Wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted: Jatin Sarna on battling depression
383.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actor Jatin Sarna said that the last few years were quite hard and depressing for him. "I wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted...I felt...nothing was happening around me and started feeling...depressed...Moreover, I was staying alone," he added. Jatin said he didn't take "any clinical help" but "a year of introspection" and "close friends" helped him heal.

384.title: Bihar starts survey to prepare exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts
384.article_body: The Bihar government is in the process of preparing an exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts of the state to address the local environmental issues, BSPCB Member Secretary, S Chandrasekar, said. BSPCB has engaged an agency to conduct a survey in all the districts to prepare the district environment plan and the agency has started the work, he added.

385.title: 19 presumed dead as boat carrying 23 migrants capsizes near Libya
385.article_body: Authorities have said that 19 people are missing and presumed dead after a boat carrying about 23 migrants capsized in Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Libya on Saturday. Three people have been rescued and sent to the hospital, while one body has been retrieved, Libya's coast guard said. The boat had set off from Tobruk, the coast guard added.

386.title: Mumbai woman injured while trying to resist chain snatcher inside running train
386.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck while trying to resist a suspected chain snatcher inside a running train in Mumbai. The woman was travelling to Churchgate in women's coach. When the train halted at Charni Road railway station, the accused entered the coach and tried to steal her gold chain. The woman resisted and chased the thief, who escaped.

387.title: PM Bennett did not ask Zelenskyy to take Putin's deal: Israel, Ukraine
387.article_body: A media report claiming that Israel PM Naftali Bennett suggested Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to give in to Russian demands was denied by both countries. "At no point did PM Bennett advise President Zelenskyy to take a deal from Putin," said an Israeli official. A Ukrainian adviser said Israel "does not offer Ukraine to agree to any demands" of Russia.

388.title: Arvind Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann visit Golden Temple in Amritsar ahead of roadshow
388.article_body: Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar, ahead of their roadshow to mark the party's victory in Punjab polls. Mann received Kejriwal and party leader Manish Sisodia at Amritsar airport today. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

389.title: Shatrughan Sinha, Babul Supriyo to fight for TMC in West Bengal bypolls: Mamata
389.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday took to Twitter to announce that veteran actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha will be TMC's candidate in Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Mamata further stated that singer and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo will be the party's candidate in Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat.

390.title: Massive fire that broke out at Kolkata tannery yet to be extinguished after 16 hrs
390.article_body: The massive fire which broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Tangra area of West Bengal's Kolkata on Saturday night, is yet to be extinguished even after over 16 hours. Officials said firefighters haven't been able to enter the godown due to the presence of some highly inflammable materials inside. Two fire brigade personnel have sustained injuries.

391.title: Punjab win gives AAP, our model of governance national recognition: Manish Sisodia
391.article_body: AAP leader Manish Sisodia said that the partyâ€™s massive victory in Punjab gives national recognition to the AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwalâ€™s model of governance. Sisodia added that when a political party becomes a credible alternative it's bound to emerge as a winner. "Right now, our priority is the people of Punjab. We will focus on fulfilling our promises," Sisodia stated.

392.title: At least 60 killed, dozens injured as Cargo train crashes in Congo
392.article_body: At least 60 people were killed and dozens injured after a cargo train crashed in Congo on Friday. The passengers had reportedly boarded the train illegally. "Seven of the carriages ended up in the ravine," said Clementine Lutanda, the local administrator. The accident occurred when the train fell off the track while going up a slope.

393.title: Ashneer Grover denies owning â‚¹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
393.article_body: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent â‚¹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press â€“ don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies â€“ you'll lose credibility like them."

394.title: WI earn draw vs Eng in 1st Test despite losing 4 wickets for 8 runs on final day
394.article_body: WI's Jason Holder and Nkrumah Bonner played a total of 239 deliveries on the final day of the first Test against England as the match ended in a draw. Joe Root slammed his 24th Test century in their second innings to help England set a target of 286 runs. WI were reduced to 67/4 before ending game at 147/4.

395.title: China's new local COVID-19 cases triple amid its worst outbreak
395.article_body: China reported 1,807 new local symptomatic coronavirus cases, more than triple than what was reported the previous day, the National Health Commission said on Sunday as the country faces its worst outbreak in two years. Of the total cases, Jilin province reported the highest at 1,412. Earlier, China locked down Jilin's provincial capital city Changchun over spike in COVID-19 cases.

396.title: For actors, performance trumps discomfort: Shruti on kissing Mugdha in show
396.article_body: Actress Shruti Seth, speaking about her on-screen kiss with Mugdha Godse in the upcoming series 'Bloody Brothers', said, "It was funny because both of us had never done a scene like it before." "Shaad (Ali, director) really put us at ease. And then for actors, the performance trumps discomfort so we eventually made it seem totally natural," she added.

397.title: Religious fanaticism, communal hysteria rising in country: RSS
397.article_body: Religious fanaticism and acts of communal hysteria are being spread in the country under the cover of the Constitution and religious freedom, the RSS said in its annual report. "Efforts are afoot to weaken the society by rising various fissiparous tendencies in the Hindu society itself," RSS said in the report.

398.title: Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills: Sachin to Sreesanth
398.article_body: After Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket, Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to congratulate the fast bowler. He wrote, "Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills. Congratulations @sreesanthnair36, on representing India over the years.  All the very best for your 2nd innings."

399.title: Posters criticising Venugopal surface in Kerala after Cong's defeat
399.article_body: Following Congress' defeat in Assembly polls, posters criticising party leader KC Venugopal have surfaced near a party office in Kerala's Kannur. The posters read- "Save Congress- thanks to Venugopal for what happened in five states where Congress was wiped out". State Congress chief K Sudhakaran reacted to this saying that everyone has a "collective responsibility for successes and failures".

400.title: Sonia, Rahul should discharge their duties properly: JD(U) chief
400.article_body: Janata Dal (United) president Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh has asked senior Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, to "discharge their duties properly" in order to "save the decline of Congress". He further asked Congress to "come out with a proper roadmap" in the backdrop of the party's defeat in the five states' assembly elections.

401.title: RCB have made the right choice in appointing Plessis as captain: Karthik
401.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said RCB have made the right choice in appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for the upcoming season. "Faf is at that stage in his career when he's ready to take on the responsibility...he's a great tactician," stated Karthik, who'll also feature for the franchise this season. Karthik was bought by RCB for â‚¹5.5 crore.
